column3: Will I be able to travel throughout Boston on bike without dangerous cars passing by on my left and right?
Will there be better access to Cambridge (Central Square) from non-Red Line areas?
Why don't all the subway lines reach out to the 128 belt?
What percentage of lbs area have we dedicated to cars and car storage in Boston? How could this space be used better for walkers, bikers or transit riders?
Why isn't the T accessible for strollers or wheelchairs?
How does BRT fit into the scheme of t public transportation moving forward?
Will I be able to get around as a senior with mobility issues?
What transportation will they have for the blind in the future?
What are the plans for mass transit availability for the South Boston waterfront?

Why can't most of Downtown Crossing and Chinatown be pedestrian only? Then Boston can put in a light rail through the streets. Cities in Europe over 1000 years old have done it (see Amsterdam, Vienna, Munich).
Will we get any new train lines, especially an urban ring?
When will Roxbury get real BRT?

We understand that during this present snow emergency in January that the City is stretched to the maximum of its resources in trying to remove the snow.  Eight to 12 feet of snow has been piled on areas of handicapped ramps where leaving the block becomes a big problem for the disabled.  I was wondering if special consideration could be applied to areas and buildings that are designated elderly/disabled?  Thank you very much for any assistance you can give in this area.
Handicap accessibility- How good is it going to be?
Will there be more transportation in the Boston area?
If the city of Boston believes in equitable access to public transportation what will they do to make the RIDE meet the needs of people with disabilities?

As both Boston and Cambridge expand and their innovation districts multiply, how do we ensure we connect our collective genius?  All roads should not head downtown!  We need pathways from Boston Medical Center to Longwood, Fort Point to Somerville to Fenway...
What will it take for Boston to be the world's leading city for bicycling?
How are you going to get people to places that are not near a rail stop?
How can public transport be simpler to navigate?
The cost of a single ride in Boston is $2.10. It's $2.15 in DC, $2.25 in San Francisco, and $2.50 in NYC. Why can't we increase the fee to improve service? You get what you pay for.
Will the buses be more affordable in the future for seniors?
Why do they raise the prices on the bus?
So in the future, will the T reinstate monthly subway (for train use only) passes?
Will the price of taking the T in Boston ever go back down?
Is it going to be affordable for the handicapped and elderly?
How can the T fare stop increasing?
Will we still have to pay with for the bus pass?
How can we make public transit more affordable and accessible than driving to incentivize public transit commuters?
When will all people have good transportation service?
Will I have a proper T station in the South End?
How can the city make sure that the poor and working people benefit from this new vision?
As you know we have too much snow in the front of 755 Tremont st. in Boston, MA 0218. The crosswalk and mailbox we can't get to.
Why can't we not allow people with twins in double wide strollers on the buses?
Why don't they have public bathrooms on the bus?  Or at the stations?
Can the transportation department work with other city departments to ensure snow removal occurs on sidewalks, handicap ramps, and fire hydrants?
Can we have a bar/social cabin on the commuter rail? I would pay 4-5 dollars for a beer or glass of wine on an hour long commute.
Will there be more room for mothers and people shopping on the bus?
What conditions will the road be in?
Are we going to get newer trains?
Will there be better cold weather options for the bus?
Will there be enough parking spaces for cars?
Other systems have more efficient train systems. To maximize efficiency, we need new rails.  What is the plan to use what works and replace where appropriate?
In the future when snow removal is done; they should dig out hydrants, handicap ramps, mailboxes and not allow large piles of snow to impair the drivers and pedestrians vision?
Will the city transportation department work closely with DPW to make handicap parking spaces snow free during the winter?
Can we have warm shelters near the MBTA ferry docks here in Boston and in Hull?
Since our transportation funding is determined at the state level, what can the City of Boston do to elevate transportation funding as a state-wide issue?
Can there be more taxes and bigger ones for families?
Can Boston become a world class city by creating a place-based mobility plan that leaverages land use and transit hubs to capture value?
Will the City really listen to our ideas?
Have truly dedicated lanes for buses only, no cars or double-parking allowed. Have a bus lane, then a small median, then a parking lane, and then a car lane.
Can there be a more efficient process for qualifying and reapplying for the RIDE?
In the future will there be more buses?
Can we reduce pedestrian wait times at crosswalks during times of extreme temperature?
Why aren't the bricks that are loose on side streets ever fixed?
Will the city put in place rules and regulations for bike riders?
How will the cities new transportation vision address the many mobility challenges presented during jan/feb 2015 snow storm?
How can the MBTA ensure that rider feedback complaints are addressed?
Miss Pauline wants to know if the city is really going to listen to the voices of this question campaign? (she has lost faith).
Why can't you track the train like you can track the bus?
Will T buses and Rollie's have WiFi?
When will we get moving sidewalks,  or underground mall, walkways similar to toronto, Montreal or above ground like Minneapolis and Calgary!
Both residents and the Mayor want more housing in the city.  How can we get more people on the road, but have fewer cars?
When can I fly around the city like the Jetsons?
Can we get moving sidewalks? (like at the airport)
Why don't you like Segways?
Will transportation be innovative and progressive?
What if public transportation vehicles are operated by robots?
Why can transit become sexy enough that people want to take it? What value adds can Boston bring to the transit experience?
When is the Green line going to get timed arrival notifications?
Will we ever get horse-drawn carriage rides in the Common?
When will there be a smoother system with better looking buses and trains where breakdowns don't happen?
What would it be like if the Orange and Green Lines could handle rush-hour traffic? Actually what would it be like if the trains could hold more people?

In the winter Boston Public Works have to prepare for snow storms early. The roads should be sanded and salted. The side streets should be plowed as well as the main roads. The handicap ramps are blocked y snow piles. The MBTA should continue the late night service that they are trying out.
Will the MBTA create late night service?
What are they going to do about excessive traffic congestion?
Can the T run 24 hours?
Will the hours of operation be extended to have a 24 hr system?
How can we improve the bus service?  It is supposed to come every 20 minutes and I waited for over an hour to get home 3 days in a row - very hard, especially when it's cold out!
What if we could rely on our public transportation system to get us to work during adverse weather conditions?
Make the #1 bus double length like the silver line.
What's the Olympics going to do to transportation?
How can you make the #1 bus on time?
Why is our Silver line so slow on the streets? Can we have real BRT like China, Mexico or South Africa?
How are you going to get me to work at BWH to help my patients during a snow storm?
How does the MBTA plan on organizing the city during the Olympics? Where will all the tourists go?
Can we add more lighting at all bus stops to ensure safety?
Why don't they do maintenance on the MBTA more often?
Will the staff be more kind?
Will we find ways to use the water and sky to move us around the city?
Will Boston ever have an open streets or "biking-only" times, like Ciclovia in Bogota, Colombia?
When will more people use non-car transport to get to work?
When will public transit spending surpass road spending?
How can we use more energy efficient forms of transportation?
How can we make public transit greener?
Offer more parking for Enterprise Car Share and Zip Car!
